 Ambulatory Progress Note w/Columbia Assessment

  Narrative

 TRAVEL TIME: 0/2:46-2:59 (onto a therapy client)
TIME DEDUCTED (IF NEEDED): 5 min for her Xray (actual end time was 3:04)
SITUATION: Lora had a follow up appt with Dr. Tag on this date as she had broken her L upper arm several weeks ago.
INTERVENTION: Writer escorted Lora from the day program to KC Ortho Clinic for her 1:20 appt. On the way, we discussed how well Lora has been doing and how this appt should be quite easy. Writer and Lora then arrived the clinic and writer assisted Lora with signing in and filling out the required paperwork. Writer and Lora then waited until her name was called which it eventually was. Lora met with the nurse and then she was escorted to get an Xray of her arm. Dr. Tag's PA then met with us and stated that she is "doing great" and she should keep up her physical therapy (which she does at the day program). Writer and Lora then made another follow up appt for 6 weeks and then departed. Writer escorted Lora home and then departed. 
RESPONSE: Lora was in a good mood and stated that she is glad that she does not have to wear her sling any longer and she can do more physical exercises. Lora was happy that her arm is healing like it should and she had no other concerns on this date. Lora was very appreciative for the assistance on this day.
PLAN: Lora will continue to come to day program every day and writer will assist with medical appts as they arise.


 

  Goals

 Problems-> Paranoid schizophrenia
Goals-> "I would like to keep going to day program and stay busy, keep coloring. I want to stay away from people that cause problems."
Objectives-> Lora will follow up on physical health by attending PCP appointments monthly and going to specialists if needed. She will complete eye exam by end of October of 2025. She will stay up to date with routine exams. She will take care of hearing aids and wear them daily. She will inform CM if needing to meet with audiologist due to any concerns that arise.
Interventions-> PCP/Specialists will offer medication management and treatment recommendations. Case Worker will assist client by encouraging her to speak up about any concerns she is having. CM will provide support for client utilizing hearing aids and ensure she is able to communicate concerns effectively.

 

  Form

 Columbia Assessment

 1. In the past month, have you wished you were dead or wished you could go to sleep and not wake up?: Not Assessed

 Comments: Lora has never displayed SI as long as I have known her (18 yrs)

 2. In the past month, have you actually had any thoughts about killing yourself?: Not Assessed

 6. In the past 3 months, have you done anything, started to do anything, or prepared to do anything to end your life?: Not Assessed

 Is this an In-person visit?: Yes

 

   Electronically Signed by: LARRY LAUVETZ, LPC

  Individual:    Name:  BRITTNEY FORBES

 Practitioner:  DESIREE LORENZO

 Service Charge Code:  Crisis Services (1240)
 Service Program:  2621-PES Adult-LOC 1 (2621)
 myAvatar Note Type:  Crisis
 

  Draft/Final:  Final
 Visit Date/Time:   09/30/2025 10:59 AM  -  11:52 AM 
 

 PES 1240 Progress Note

  Narrative

 Brittney is 35 years old, cisgender female, English speaker who presented to PES by herself referred by the ER. Brittney appears to be oriented in time, place and person. Brittney is dressed appropriately and appears to have her hygiene intact. Brittney presented with a flat affect and calm/cooperative mood. Brittney was able to maintain appropriate eye contact and appears to have linear thought process. Brittney expressed having passive SI "If I die tomorrow, I wouldn't care", Denied any plan or intention. Brittney denied any HI, SIB or AVH. 

Brittney shared having the following mental health disorders: Major depressive disorder (F 33.1), traumatic stress disorder (F43.10), Generalized Anxiety Disorder (F 41.1) and borderline personality disorder (F60.3). Brittney shared that she is currently taking the following medications: Wellbutrin, Hydroxyzine, Trazodone and Methadone. Stated that she feels like her meds aren't working. Brittney shared experiencing the following symptoms: Anxiety, lack of sleep, intrusive thoughts, racing thoughts, flashbacks, paranoia ("people trying to hurt me"), lack of motivation, trouble concentrating and hopelessness. Brittney shared having a history of previous suicidal attempts with the last one being in 2014, when she attempted to end her life by overdosing on Heroine. Brittney also shared having a history of previous Self harm with the last one being in 2017 when she cut her wrist. Brittney shared having a history of previous psych hospitalizations but was unable to identify when her last hospitalization was. Brittney shared having a history of trauma expressing that there is childhood trauma and sexual abuse trauma as a child and adult. Identifying that she was rapped as a kid by her older brother. Brittney also shared a history of impulsive and aggressive behavior. Mentioning that she often acts without thinking and that she has a hard time managing/expressing her emotions. Brittney shared also having family history of mental health disorders and suicide.

QMHP-CS implemented PHQ-9 to identify how Brittney has been feeling in the past 2 weeks. In this assessment Brittney scored a 20, indicating that she is currently experiencing Severe Depression.

In Regard to her physical health Brittney shared having Hypothyroidism and stated that she is taking medications for it. Denied any other or current medical conditions or concerns. Shared having the following allergies: Shellfish, Bee and Codeine. Brittney also shared having a SUD expressing that she started using substances when she was 11 years old (crack) and that she is currently using weed and alcohol daily. Identifying the last used as last night. Brittney denied any other substance use including smoking and vaping.

Brittney denied any current Legal issues other than been a victim of domestic violence and stated that she was able to make a police report against her aggressor.

Brittney shared that her goal for today is to be able to be stable and be in a safe space where she can work on her mental health and change her medications. QMHP-CS is referring Brittney for CRU to assist with stabilization due to current presentation. QMHP-CS staffed with UM and Brittney was accepted into CRU at the Inn for a higher level of care. Brittney was able to safety plan with QMHP-CS and agreed to meet with Peer support to assist with Treatment Support for her SUD after being discharged from CRU. QMHP-CS encouraged Brittney to follow up with intake for ongoing services. QMHP-CS provided community resources, Domestic violence resources, intake information, warm lines and Peer support information. At the time of this assessment Brittney expressed experiencing passive SI but denied HI, any plan or intent. Brittney also denied having access to any substances or weapons/firearms.

 PES 1240 Progress Note

  Narrative

 Brittney is 35 years old, cisgender female, English speaker who presented to PES by herself referred by the ER. Brittney appears to be oriented in time, place and person. Brittney is dressed appropriately and appears to have her hygiene intact. Brittney presented with a flat affect and calm/cooperative mood. Brittney was able to maintain appropriate eye contact and appears to have linear thought process. Brittney expressed having passive SI "If I die tomorrow, I wouldn't care", Denied any plan or intention. Brittney denied any HI, SIB or AVH. 

Brittney shared having the following mental health disorders: Major depressive disorder (F 33.1), traumatic stress disorder (F43.10), Generalized Anxiety Disorder (F 41.1) and borderline personality disorder (F60.3). Brittney shared that she is currently taking the following medications: Wellbutrin, Hydroxyzine, Trazodone and Methadone. Stated that she feels like her meds aren't working. Brittney shared experiencing the following symptoms: Anxiety, lack of sleep, intrusive thoughts, racing thoughts, flashbacks, paranoia ("people trying to hurt me"), lack of motivation, trouble concentrating and hopelessness. Brittney shared having a history of previous suicidal attempts with the last one being in 2014, when she attempted to end her life by overdosing on Heroine. Brittney also shared having a history of previous Self harm with the last one being in 2017 when she cut her wrist. Brittney shared having a history of previous psych hospitalizations but was unable to identify when her last hospitalization was. Brittney shared having a history of trauma expressing that there is childhood trauma and sexual abuse trauma as a child and adult. Identifying that she was rapped as a kid by her older brother. Brittney also shared a history of impulsive and aggressive behavior. Mentioning that she often acts without thinking and that she has a hard time managing/expressing her emotions. Brittney shared also having family history of mental health disorders and suicide.

QMHP-CS implemented PHQ-9 to identify how Brittney has been feeling in the past 2 weeks. In this assessment Brittney scored a 20, indicating that she is currently experiencing Severe Depression.

In Regard to her physical health Brittney shared having Hypothyroidism and stated that she is taking medications for it. Denied any other or current medical conditions or concerns. Shared having the following allergies: Shellfish, Bee and Codeine. Brittney also shared having a SUD expressing that she started using substances when she was 11 years old (crack) and that she is currently using weed and alcohol daily. Identifying the last used as last night. Brittney denied any other substance use including smoking and vaping.

Brittney denied any current Legal issues other than been a victim of domestic violence and stated that she was able to make a police report against her aggressor.

Brittney shared that her goal for today is to be able to be stable and be in a safe space where she can work on her mental health and change her medications. QMHP-CS is referring Brittney for CRU to assist with stabilization due to current presentation. QMHP-CS staffed with UM and Brittney was accepted into CRU at the Inn for a higher level of care. Brittney was able to safety plan with QMHP-CS and agreed to meet with Peer support to assist with Treatment Support for her SUD after being discharged from CRU. QMHP-CS encouraged Brittney to follow up with intake for ongoing services. QMHP-CS provided community resources, Domestic violence resources, intake information, warm lines and Peer support information. At the time of this assessment Brittney expressed experiencing passive SI but denied HI, any plan or intent. Brittney also denied having access to any substances or weapons/firearms.

John was sitting on his bed watching TV when MCOT arrived and appeared well groomed, dressed in casual clothes. John's mood was low and his affect was congruent; however, he was able to smile and laugh appropriately at time. His speech was clear, coherent, and of normal rate and volume and his thought processes were linear and logical. John explained that "was doing fine" until yesterday (9/28) when he started "digging up stuff from my past." He described missing his mom, whom he was the caretaker for until she passed away. John denied current SI, HI, AVH, and SUD. He disclosed that he has a history of SIB and pointed to long scars on his forearms where he had engaged in cutting, but stated that the last time he self-harmed was 15 years ago. John described having little to no appetite and that he has only been having water and protein shakes for the past 4 weeks. He added that the past two times he's tried to eat solid food, he has gotten sick. John endorsed sleeping 6 - 8 hours a night and taking naps during the day. When asked about current abuse or neglect, John said he liked the facility he was in but disclosed enduring neglectful treatment at San Gabriel Rehabilitation and Care Center in the past, stating, "they treated me terribly". John also disclosed that he has childhood trauma and was molested as a child. John explained that his current coping skills include going on walks and doing push-ups and sit-ups but that he would like to get a therapist and receive mental health counseling. John endorsed having people to talk to, including the staff at his current nursing facility. John does not have transportation and is unsure of his current discharge date. Mom will work on imitating 2 words during playtime routines

Mom reported Jasutdu has been doing good, he has a nose bleed last night due to getting hot
 
Joint plan for today's visit?
Work on imitaiting 2 word phrases 
 
Provider observed? 
Provider observed Jasutdu was in a happy mood upon arrival, he was watching TV, mom the cut off the TV to transition into visit, Jasutdu transitioned well, he grabbed many toys out if the box to show off
 
Action/Practice? 
Jasutdu pointed towards various items and named it to EIS demonstrated adding on to the words Jasutdu said to work on imitating 2 words, Jasutdu did showed a star then said "Star", EIS then asked "What color is the star?", Jasutdu replied "green", EIS then reassured him, "green star", mom then returned demonstrated naming various toys while adding a word, "red dice, monster truck", Jasutdu then imitated "monster truck", Jasutdu then wanted to play with a truck, We practiced saying "Ready, set, go", Jasutdu imitated each time. The truck then broke in half, Jasutdu became upset by this, he ran to mom and said "broke", Jasutdu then ran up to EIS and said "teacher", EIS asked "do you need help", Jasutdu replied by shaking his head, EIS responded "yes help", then proceeded to help Jasutdu fix the toy. QMHP met face to face with Dave at the Integral Care Health Resource Center located at Community First! Village for living skills training in service of his stated goal of "I need to talk to Molly."

GIRPP Progress Note

Title of Curriculum Used: imr

IMR Curriculum: topic 08: coping with stress, topic 08a: relaxation techniques, and topic 10: getting your needs met by the mental health system



GIRPP Note Narratives


Intervention: QMHP provided empathic and reflective listening to support DAVE as he described anger and frustration connected to being informed that he is not able to see Molly Baker, LPHA with the Community First! Village Integral Care (IC) treatment team. QMHP reviewed stress coping skills with Dave and reminded him that talking about his stress and utilizing relaxation techniques were two effective coping skills to help reduce stress and mental health symptoms (IMR Topic 08). QMHP recommended Dave practice deep breathing to help relax, so he could more effectively communicate his needs to QMHP and the medical providers at Community Care (IMR Topic 08a). QMHP modeled deep breathing and encouraged Dave to join the practice (IMR Topic 08a). QMHP commended Dave for utilizing positive self talk as a stress coping skills (IMR Topic 08). QMHP and Dave discussed ways he can get his need for a therapist met including: discussing his options with his case managers and preparing by listing out the important qualities that he is looking for in a therapist (IMR Topic 10). 

Response: Dave presented appearing emotionally labile and disorganized. Dave alternated between angry outbursts and crying and stated "I don't want to come undone." Dave engaged with QMHP in deep breathing and stated "I'm going to take 72 deep breaths." Dave stated "I can get through this, I don't want to come undone." Dave reported wanting a therapist that "gets him and what he went through" and "someone who can give me an amnesia pill." Dave appeared more emotionally stable and organized by the end of the meeting. Dave stated "I am reaching out for help and thank you, thank you. Are you on Haleigh's team? She helps me a lot." 

Progress: Dave demonstrated progress towards his stated goal by participating in relaxation technique practice and utilizing stress coping skills to reduce stress and mental health symptoms enough to discuss ways he can get his needs met by the mental health symptom and find a therapist to support him in the way he needs. 

Referrals: No referrals at this time. 

Plan/Future Actions: Dave will follow up with his case managers, Haleigh Rasco and Jakori Tinsley. Dave will meet with Jakori today at 2:30 pm and will meet Haleight on 10/2/25. QMHP will report details of this meeting to Dave's care team.

  Narrative

 TRAVEL TIME: 0/2:46-2:59 (onto a therapy client)
TIME DEDUCTED (IF NEEDED): 5 min for her Xray (actual end time was 3:04)
SITUATION: Lora had a follow up appt with Dr. Tag on this date as she had broken her L upper arm several weeks ago.
INTERVENTION: Writer escorted Lora from the day program to KC Ortho Clinic for her 1:20 appt. On the way, we discussed how well Lora has been doing and how this appt should be quite easy. Writer and Lora then arrived the clinic and writer assisted Lora with signing in and filling out the required paperwork. Writer and Lora then waited until her name was called which it eventually was. Lora met with the nurse and then she was escorted to get an Xray of her arm. Dr. Tag's PA then met with us and stated that she is "doing great" and she should keep up her physical therapy (which she does at the day program). Writer and Lora then made another follow up appt for 6 weeks and then departed. Writer escorted Lora home and then departed. 
RESPONSE: Lora was in a good mood and stated that she is glad that she does not have to wear her sling any longer and she can do more physical exercises. Lora was happy that her arm is healing like it should and she had no other concerns on this date. Lora was very appreciative for the assistance on this day.
PLAN: Lora will continue to come to day program every day and writer will assist with medical appts as they arise.


 

  Goals

 Problems-> Paranoid schizophrenia
Goals-> "I would like to keep going to day program and stay busy, keep coloring. I want to stay away from people that cause problems."
Objectives-> Lora will follow up on physical health by attending PCP appointments monthly and going to specialists if needed. She will complete eye exam by end of October of 2025. She will stay up to date with routine exams. She will take care of hearing aids and wear them daily. She will inform CM if needing to meet with audiologist due to any concerns that arise.
Interventions-> PCP/Specialists will offer medication management and treatment recommendations. Case Worker will assist client by encouraging her to speak up about any concerns she is having. CM will provide support for client utilizing hearing aids and ensure she is able to communicate concerns effectively.

 Ambulatory Progress Note w/Columbia Assessment

  Narrative

 TRAVEL TIME: 0/2:46-2:59 (onto a therapy client)
TIME DEDUCTED (IF NEEDED): 5 min for her Xray (actual end time was 3:04)
SITUATION: Lora had a follow up appt with Dr. Tag on this date as she had broken her L upper arm several weeks ago.
INTERVENTION: Writer escorted Lora from the day program to KC Ortho Clinic for her 1:20 appt. On the way, we discussed how well Lora has been doing and how this appt should be quite easy. Writer and Lora then arrived the clinic and writer assisted Lora with signing in and filling out the required paperwork. Writer and Lora then waited until her name was called which it eventually was. Lora met with the nurse and then she was escorted to get an Xray of her arm. Dr. Tag's PA then met with us and stated that she is "doing great" and she should keep up her physical therapy (which she does at the day program). Writer and Lora then made another follow up appt for 6 weeks and then departed. Writer escorted Lora home and then departed. 
RESPONSE: Lora was in a good mood and stated that she is glad that she does not have to wear her sling any longer and she can do more physical exercises. Lora was happy that her arm is healing like it should and she had no other concerns on this date. Lora was very appreciative for the assistance on this day.
PLAN: Lora will continue to come to day program every day and writer will assist with medical appts as they arise.


 

  Goals

 Problems-> Paranoid schizophrenia
Goals-> "I would like to keep going to day program and stay busy, keep coloring. I want to stay away from people that cause problems."
Objectives-> Lora will follow up on physical health by attending PCP appointments monthly and going to specialists if needed. She will complete eye exam by end of October of 2025. She will stay up to date with routine exams. She will take care of hearing aids and wear them daily. She will inform CM if needing to meet with audiologist due to any concerns that arise.
Interventions-> PCP/Specialists will offer medication management and treatment recommendations. Case Worker will assist client by encouraging her to speak up about any concerns she is having. CM will provide support for client utilizing hearing aids and ensure she is able to communicate concerns effectively.

 PES 1240 Progress Note

  Narrative

 Brittney is 35 years old, cisgender female, English speaker who presented to PES by herself referred by the ER. Brittney appears to be oriented in time, place and person. Brittney is dressed appropriately and appears to have her hygiene intact. Brittney presented with a flat affect and calm/cooperative mood. Brittney was able to maintain appropriate eye contact and appears to have linear thought process. Brittney expressed having passive SI "If I die tomorrow, I wouldn't care", Denied any plan or intention. Brittney denied any HI, SIB or AVH. 

Brittney shared having the following mental health disorders: Major depressive disorder (F 33.1), traumatic stress disorder (F43.10), Generalized Anxiety Disorder (F 41.1) and borderline personality disorder (F60.3). Brittney shared that she is currently taking the following medications: Wellbutrin, Hydroxyzine, Trazodone and Methadone. Stated that she feels like her meds aren't working. Brittney shared experiencing the following symptoms: Anxiety, lack of sleep, intrusive thoughts, racing thoughts, flashbacks, paranoia ("people trying to hurt me"), lack of motivation, trouble concentrating and hopelessness. Brittney shared having a history of previous suicidal attempts with the last one being in 2014, when she attempted to end her life by overdosing on Heroine. Brittney also shared having a history of previous Self harm with the last one being in 2017 when she cut her wrist. Brittney shared having a history of previous psych hospitalizations but was unable to identify when her last hospitalization was. Brittney shared having a history of trauma expressing that there is childhood trauma and sexual abuse trauma as a child and adult. Identifying that she was rapped as a kid by her older brother. Brittney also shared a history of impulsive and aggressive behavior. Mentioning that she often acts without thinking and that she has a hard time managing/expressing her emotions. Brittney shared also having family history of mental health disorders and suicide.

QMHP-CS implemented PHQ-9 to identify how Brittney has been feeling in the past 2 weeks. In this assessment Brittney scored a 20, indicating that she is currently experiencing Severe Depression.

In Regard to her physical health Brittney shared having Hypothyroidism and stated that she is taking medications for it. Denied any other or current medical conditions or concerns. Shared having the following allergies: Shellfish, Bee and Codeine. Brittney also shared having a SUD expressing that she started using substances when she was 11 years old (crack) and that she is currently using weed and alcohol daily. Identifying the last used as last night. Brittney denied any other substance use including smoking and vaping.

Brittney denied any current Legal issues other than been a victim of domestic violence and stated that she was able to make a police report against her aggressor.

Brittney shared that her goal for today is to be able to be stable and be in a safe space where she can work on her mental health and change her medications. QMHP-CS is referring Brittney for CRU to assist with stabilization due to current presentation. QMHP-CS staffed with UM and Brittney was accepted into CRU at the Inn for a higher level of care. Brittney was able to safety plan with QMHP-CS and agreed to meet with Peer support to assist with Treatment Support for her SUD after being discharged from CRU. QMHP-CS encouraged Brittney to follow up with intake for ongoing services. QMHP-CS provided community resources, Domestic violence resources, intake information, warm lines and Peer support information. At the time of this assessment Brittney expressed experiencing passive SI but denied HI, any plan or intent. Brittney also denied having access to any substances or weapons/firearms.

 Crisis Services (1240) Progress Note

  Narrative

 MCOT arrived at Pflugerville Nursing and Rehabilitation Center to meet with John following a routine dispatch from hotline. MCOT checked in at the front desk and met with John in his room for the duration of the assessment. John was sitting on his bed watching TV when MCOT arrived and appeared well groomed, dressed in casual clothes. John's mood was low and his affect was congruent; however, he was able to smile and laugh appropriately at time. His speech was clear, coherent, and of normal rate and volume and his thought processes were linear and logical. John explained that "was doing fine" until yesterday (9/28) when he started "digging up stuff from my past." He described missing his mom, whom he was the caretaker for until she passed away. John denied current SI, HI, AVH, and SUD. He disclosed that he has a history of SIB and pointed to long scars on his forearms where he had engaged in cutting, but stated that the last time he self-harmed was 15 years ago. John described having little to no appetite and that he has only been having water and protein shakes for the past 4 weeks. He added that the past two times he's tried to eat solid food, he has gotten sick. John endorsed sleeping 6 - 8 hours a night and taking naps during the day. When asked about current abuse or neglect, John said he liked the facility he was in but disclosed enduring neglectful treatment at San Gabriel Rehabilitation and Care Center in the past, stating, "they treated me terribly". John also disclosed that he has childhood trauma and was molested as a child. John explained that his current coping skills include going on walks and doing push-ups and sit-ups but that he would like to get a therapist and receive mental health counseling. John endorsed having people to talk to, including the staff at his current nursing facility. John does not have transportation and is unsure of his current discharge date. MCOT provided information about IC and the services offered, including housing and case management, as well as a business card with IC's hotline information. John expressed confidence in his ability to contact emergency services as needed. MCOT will follow up to ensure safety and connection to resources. 

 

  Clinical Quality Indicator
